intro: Vernonia comorinensis, commonly known as the Comorin ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pale yellow to brownish flowers. Its inflorescence is a cylindrical spike, which is characteristic of the genus Vernonia. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
